person_array.title: snowboarder
person_array.quote_text: The Rockford friends, who have been practicing jumping and twirling tricks at Cannonsburg for a decade, said a "long" summer and fall left them eager to bust out their boards.

person_array.title: 22-year-old snowboarder
person_array.quote_text: "You have to wait all summer for it to start snowing, so you might as well (hit the hill) as soon as the snow falls," the 22-year-old VanderVelde said Sunday.

person_array.title: manager at Pando Winter Sports Park
person_array.quote_text: "We went from green grass to a lot of snow," said Pete Goodell, a manager at Pando. "We still had to make a lot with the machines, but it was a great start.

person_array.title: National Weather Service meteorologist
person_array.quote_text: Bob Dukesherer, a National Weather Service meteorologist, says it's a near certainty that will happen by Tuesday, when a storm will settle in and hang over the region through Saturday.

person_array.title: manager at Cannonsburg Ski Area
person_array.quote_text: The forecast should make for good business at Cannonsburg, which drew several hundred customers on its first day of business Sunday, manager Steve Brown said.

person_array.title: Skier
person_array.quote_text: Skier Rick DeGraaf, who was headed for his second ride on the lift at Cannonsburg on Sunday, said the day's moderate temperatures made for a nice day on the hill.
